column4: got a question. I have a desktop using FC5, but am setting up a server on an older pentium3. Would Ubuntu be a good choice (its mainly for mail, host a page or two, irc and ftp). Also, does Ubuntu use a package manager for installs/downloads, and a gui (I would be lost with console only)

you can use ubuntu (or really, any distro) for that. With ubuntu, I would recommend you install the 'server' build first, then only install what you need. Its a lot easier than installing the entire desktop, and then deleting stuff.
might also want to see libgtk2.0-dev - Development files for the GTK+ library
